intro: Symplectrodia lanosa, commonly known as the woolly symplectrodia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
